content.full_text: Account of James Odham to James Rutledge, 12 January 18331 James OdhamToJames RutledgeDr2
paragraphs: Account of James Odham to James Rutledge, 12 January 18331 James OdhamToJames RutledgeDr2
citations: Benjamin P. Thomas,Lincoln’s New Salem(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1934), 7, 12.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the body of the document, aside from Rutledge’s signature. Lincoln
                  also wrote Bowling Green’s endorsement; Green wrote the dateline and his own signature.

2Lincoln was known to write various documents for his friends and neighbors while he
                  lived inNew Salem. This account was likely related to the time when Rutledge turned his home into a
                  tavern for boarders.Benjamin P. Thomas,Lincoln’s New Salem(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1934), 7, 12.

structured_content.text: Account of James Odham to James Rutledge, 12 January 18331
